skill.name: chembl-database
skill.description: Query ChEMBL bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties, retrieve bioactivity data (IC50, Ki), find inhibitors, perform SAR studies, for medicinal chemistry.
skill.summary: Query ChEMBL bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties, ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

dangerous_patterns.description: Weak cryptographic algorithm detected in code

content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Query over 2 million bioactive compounds from ChEMBL database
Search molecules by name, ChEMBL ID, or structural properties
Retrieve bioactivity data (IC50, Ki, EC50) for compounds
Perform similarity and substructure searches using SMILES
Find inhibitors and bioactive molecules for specific targets
Access drug information including mechanisms and indications
Filter compounds by molecular properties (MW, LogP, HBA/HBD)
Export query results for analysis in pandas DataFrames
limitations: Requires internet connection to access ChEMBL web services
Query performance depends on ChEMBL server response time
Large result sets may be paginated and require multiple requests
Some molecular properties may be missing for certain compounds
Rate limiting enforced by ChEMBL - excessive queries may be blocked

use_cases.title: Drug Discovery Research
use_cases.description: Find potent inhibitors for specific protein targets by querying bioactivity data
use_cases.target_user: Medicinal chemists and drug discovery researchers

use_cases.title: SAR Analysis
use_cases.description: Perform structure-activity relationship studies by analyzing compound similarities and their bioactivities

use_cases.title: Compound Property Filtering
use_cases.description: Identify drug-like molecules by filtering based on molecular weight, LogP, and other physicochemical properties

use_cases.title: Drug Repurposing
use_cases.description: Explore existing drugs for new therapeutic applications by analyzing their targets and mechanisms

prompt_templates.title: Find Kinase Inhibitors
prompt_templates.prompt: Find potent kinase inhibitors with IC50 values less than 100 nM. Show me the top 10 compounds with their structures and activity data.

prompt_templates.title: Similarity Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find compounds similar to aspirin (CC(=O)Oc1ccccc1C(=O)O) with at least 80% similarity. Include their bioactivity data if available.

prompt_templates.title: Target Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Get all bioactivity data for EGFR target (CHEMBL203) including IC50, Ki, and EC50 values. Sort by potency.

prompt_templates.title: Drug Properties
prompt_templates.prompt: Find approved drugs with molecular weight between 300-500 Da and LogP less than 5. Include their indications and mechanisms.

output_examples.input: Find compounds similar to aspirin with 85% similarity threshold
output_examples.output:
Found 42 compounds similar to aspirin:

1. CHEMBL25 - Aspirin
   Similarity: 100%
   MW: 180.16 g/mol
   LogP: 1.19

2. CHEMBL123456 - Salicylic acid
   Similarity: 92%
   MW: 138.12 g/mol
   LogP: 2.06
   Bioactivity: COX-1 inhibitor (IC50 = 1.2 Î¼M)

output_examples.input: Get IC50 data for EGFR inhibitors
output_examples.output:
Retrieved 156 IC50 values for EGFR (CHEMBL203):

Most potent inhibitors:
1. CHEMBL1097 - Gefitinib
   IC50: 0.023 nM
   Type: Approved drug
   Indication: Non-small cell lung cancer

2. CHEMBL1235 - Erlotinib
   IC50: 0.032 nM
   Type: Approved drug
   Indication: Pancreatic cancer, NSCLC

best_practices: Use specific ChEMBL IDs when available for faster queries
Apply appropriate filters to limit result sets (e.g., MW <= 500 for drug-like compounds)
Check data validity fields in activity records for reliability
Use pagination for large result sets to avoid timeouts
Cache results when performing similar queries repeatedly
Respect rate limits by spacing out queries appropriately
anti_patterns: Don't query without filters on large endpoints like 'molecule' - always use filters
Avoid requesting all fields if you only need specific data - use field selection
Don't ignore units in bioactivity data - always check standard_units field
Avoid hardcoding ChEMBL IDs in production code - use searches to find them
Don't assume all compounds have complete property data - handle missing values

faq.question: What is ChEMBL?
faq.answer: ChEMBL is a manually curated database of bioactive molecules maintained by the European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI), containing over 2 million compounds and 19 million bioactivity measurements.

faq.question: How do I install the ChEMBL Python client?
faq.answer: Install using pip: 'pip install chembl_webresource_client'. This provides programmatic access to the ChEMBL database.

faq.question: What types of bioactivity data are available?
faq.answer: ChEMBL contains various bioactivity measurements including IC50, Ki, EC50, Kd, and more, with standardized values and units for comparison.

faq.question: Can I search by chemical structure?
faq.answer: Yes, you can perform similarity and substructure searches using SMILES notation, with adjustable similarity thresholds.

faq.question: How do I handle large result sets?
faq.answer: Use pagination and filtering to manage large results. The client automatically paginates, but you can also use specific filters to limit results.
